billing_credit_sbg_title: Operations related to your SBG commercial measures
billing_credit_sbg_services_intro: You are in receipt of commercial measures* relating to your service(s) impacted by the fire that broke out on our Strasbourg (SBG) site.
billing_credit_sbg_info: The amount corresponding to these commercial measures is provided in the form of a voucher** valid until 31 August 2022, and the voucher can be used on all OVHcloud services. This voucher is automatically issued***.
billing_credit_sbg_movements_intro: You can view the transaction history on this voucher in the table below.
billing_credit_sbg_tips: Please note: The voucher will be used to pay for the next automatic renewal invoices for your existing services, and it will be applied automatically. You can also use it to pay for new orders and manual renewal bills.
billing_credit_sbg_legal_info1: *This exclusive commercial gesture of free service provision is allocated to you personally, as the owner of the aforementioned services.
billing_credit_sbg_legal_info2: **If you were billed for a new service purchased after 10 March, under these commercial measures, you receive a credit note equivalent to the first bill for the service. This amount will be deducted from the voucher, as shown in the history above, and will also appear in the My bills > My credit notes tab. Your provision of free service will consist of a credit note and a voucher.
billing_credit_sbg_legal_info3: ***The voucher and any credit notes relating to the SBG commercial measures are attached to your customer account. Please note that you cannot change the connecting customer account. They are valid until 31 August 2022 inclusive. After this date they will no longer be usable, and will not be replaced or refunded. The voucher and credit notes may not be transferred, sold or transmitted in any way, free of charge or for a fee, to a third party. They cannot be used on So you Start and Kimsufi services. The voucher is not replaceable or refundable. In the event of an incident that prevents OVHcloud from processing your order, it is cancelled, and the voucher amount used for the order is credited back to the voucher, without any extension to its validity period. If you use your right of withdrawal for a service order paid in whole or in part with part or all of the voucher, the amount paid with the voucher is non-refundable in cash format, and is credited back to the voucher without any extension to its validity.
